post_text: We are so excited to begin in-person instruction next week!!!
shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
September 8 at 10:30 AM ·

MECHS will begin Phase Two of our Pandemic Response Plan on September 14th by transitioning into the "Switch-Back Hike" or hybrid model. Students will have the choice of returning to campus or remaining in the virtual learning platform. Students will have the ability to switch from in-person or virtual learning as desired. Each Thursday will be dedicated to virtual learning to make the transition smoother. Be on the lookout for more information and details to come! We can't wait to see you back at school.

post_text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Thursday, June 4 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag, you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.
text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Thursday, June 4 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag, you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
May 18 at 10:35 AM ·

Congratulations to one of our Fannin Site seniors, Shayelyn Millsaps. Shayelyn graduated back in January after completing the healthcare CTAE pathway and her CNA license. Shayelyn currently works at a horse farm where she helps take care of animals. She plans to continue her education to become a registered nurse. She says, “my favorite memory is being chosen to go on the Washington D.C. trip and having the opportunity to place the wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.” Way to go Shayelyn. MECHS is proud to call you a graduate! #graduate #classof2020 #mechsgrad2020 #1stchoicefor2ndchance #seniorspotlight

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
April 17 at 1:38 PM ·

MECHS is working diligently to provide the safest option for a commencement ceremony for the spring of 2020. Graduation was originally scheduled for May 30th; however, due to the current situation with COVID-19 graduation will either be postponed until later this summer or we will host a virtual ceremony. With that being said, Dr. Lovell and everyone at MECHS would prefer to host traditional graduation with virtual being the absolute last resort. We are working with the University of North Georgia for potential new dates and times. Once we have more guidance from Governor Kemp and the Department of Education, we will communicate that to all of you. Please be assured that graduation will be happening whether at a later date or virtually.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
March 30 at 5:17 PM ·

If you find yourself feeling isolated, worried about your family, concerned about being alone at home with children for days or weeks, or in need of essential resources like food or funds for utilities and rent, please call 1-800-CHILDREN (244-5373). MECHS counselors are also available to families and students during this time. Let’s navigate this new normal together.
text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
March 30 at 5:17 PM ·

If you find yourself feeling isolated, worried about your family, concerned about being alone at home with children for days or weeks, or in need of essential resources like food or funds for utilities and rent, please call 1-800-CHILDREN (244-5373). MECHS counselors are also available to families and students during this time. Let’s navigate this new normal together.

post_text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.
text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

post_text: Twenty-one Mountain Education Charter High School students visited the Georgia Aquarium last week. Students visited the exhibits and were entertained by the dolphin show. Lunch was at Johnny Rocket’s restaurant across the street. For many, it was their first visit to the aquarium and they were impressed by the size and activities that go on there.

post_text: Mountain Education Charter High School consists of sixteen sites throughout the North Georgia Mountains. We are proud to announce that Lexus Walden from the Fannin site earned the highest GPA of any graduating senior from all the sites. She thus earns the distinction of being the Valedictorian of Mountain Education Charter High School for 2018. We are so proud to have her represent us at graduation.
text: Mountain Education Charter High School consists of sixteen sites throughout the North Georgia Mountains. We are proud to announce that Lexus Walden from the Fannin site earned the highest GPA of any graduating senior from all the sites. She thus earns the distinction of being the Valedictorian of Mountain Education Charter High School for 2018. We are so proud to have her represent us at graduation.

post_text:
Austin Wooten is Mountain Education Charter High School’s May Student of the Month. Austin is a freshman and his work ethic has really paid off this year. He has completed three classes and is on his way to completing three more before the year is out. Austin has found that he enjoys learning about history, and good note-taking has become a newfound skill for him. He hopes to continue on with his education and pursue psychology as a major. Austin likes the independence MEC affords. Congratulations to Austin!
Mountain Education would like to thank all our Student of the Month sponsors this year: Dairy Queen, Papa’s Pizza, ETC, Blue Ridge Adventure Wear, Taco Bell and Subway. Your support of our MEC students is truly appreciated!
text:

Austin likes the independence MEC affords. Congratulations to Austin!
Mountain Education would like to thank all our Student of the Month sponsors this year: Dairy Queen, Papa’s Pizza, ETC, Blue Ridge Adventure Wear, Taco Bell and Subway. Your support of our MEC students is truly appreciated!

post_text:
Tucker Lamb is Mountain Education’s April Student of the Month. Although Tucker has only
been with MEC since January, his teachers already recognize his hard work ethic. Each night when
Tucker comes to school, he is ready to work and gives it his all. Tucker hopes to pursue a career in
computer technology, but does not have a college in mind at this time. He likes the atmosphere at MEC.
He can work independently at his own pace, and have some social interaction as well. We are proud to
congratulate Tucker this month!

post_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School proudly announces Dylan McClure as its March
Student of the Month. The staff has seen a real turn-around for Dylan. He has really made an effort to
complete his requirements and take advantage of the help offered at MEC. Dylan hopes to attend
Nashville Auto Diesel College Inc. in Tennessee once he graduates. He loves racing dirt track cars around
the Blue Ridge area and wants to apply his love of cars to a career. He likes the drama-less atmosphere
at MEC and the personal attention. We are proud of the progress Dylan has made.

post_text: Ms. Dillard discusses dual enrollment possibilities with Shea Ross. Ms. Dillard gave a presentation on dual enrollment to all MEC students during dinner last week. post_text: Mountain Education Charter High School congratulates Jefferson Jones as the February Student of the Month. Jefferson is a senior who has really been fired - up to complete his graduation requirements and graduate this May. His teachers are so proud of his work ethic and happy to see his determination to finish. Jefferson wants to major in business administration and hopes to open his own business some day. We wish Jefferson well as he continues his academic pursuits. Congratulations.
text: Mountain Education Charter High School congratulates Jefferson Jones as the February Student of the Month. Jefferson is a senior who has really been fired - up to complete his graduation requirements and graduate this May. His teachers are so proud of his work ethic and happy to see his determination to finish. Jefferson wants to major in business administration and hopes to open his own business some day. We wish Jefferson well as he continues his academic pursuits. Congratulations.

post_text:
Senior Haley Odom has been selected Mountain Education Charter High School’s January
Student of the Month. Haley joined MEC in fall and has been working hard to complete her graduation
requirements. She has applied to the University of West Georgia, Kennesaw State University and North
Georgia Technical College. She plans to pursue a career as an oncology nurse. We are very happy to
have Haley with us and congratulate her on her progress.
